title: Sign up for a beach clean!
text:
Sign up for a beach clean! 2 July 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
Travel companies are being urged to join the 38 already signed up for a beach clean as part of Make Holidays Greener month. 
The Travel Foundation chief executive Salli Felton said the companies have so far committed to clean nearly 100 beaches. 
But she added even those that cannot carry out some seaside scouring can still do their bit, by focusing on their use of plastic. 
Felton said with eight million tonnes of the stuff making its way into our oceans each year, companies can do their bit by reducing the use of, recycling and reusing plastic. 
She added hotels could access the foundation’s Plastic Reduction Toolkit - go to makeholidaysgreener.org.uk - to help hotels reduce their use of plastic, while joining Whole World Water will show them how to filter and bottle their own water. 
Felton said: “It’s fantastic to see travel businesses getting involved in Make Holidays Greener again. 
“If you can’t organise a clean-up, it’s still easy to get involved. Reduce the plastic use in your office and use our tips and facts to tell your customers how they can make a difference on holiday.” 
﻿To get involved with a beach clean, and for downloadable resources, go to makeholidaysgreener.org.uk/industry
